oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Wilma Rudolph and parents in a parade in Clarksville, Tennessee, after the Rome Olympics, 1960 October 04
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of three-time Olympic gold medal winner Wilma Rudolph and her parents as they rode in a parade after leading the Tennessee A & I University track team to victory in Rome. Rudolph agreed to participate only if the event was desegregated. This was the first desegregated public event in Clarksville, Tennessee. Forms part of the Banner Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w ; 8 x 10 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Rudolph, Wilma, 1940- ; Rudolph, Ed, d. 1961; Rudolph, Blanche, 1909-1994
Tennessee Agricultural and Industrial State University; Olympic Games (17th : 1960 : Rome, Italy)
